meanings.definition: Superlative form of dank, meaning very moist or humid.
meanings.sent1: The basement after the rainstorm was the dankest place in the house.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was at its dankest after the heavy fog rolled in.
meanings.sent3: The old cellar was so dank and musty that it was considered the dankest spot in town.
meanings.sent4: The air in the cave felt like the dankest blanket wrapping around us.
meanings.sent5: The dankest room in the house was always the bathroom after someone took a long, hot shower.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of dank, meaning very potent or high-quality (especially in reference to marijuana).
meanings.sent1: The dankest weed in town was rumored to be grown by a local farmer.
meanings.sent2: The dankest strains of marijuana are often sought after by enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends always gathered to smoke the dankest weed they could find.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the dankest marijuana filled the room, making everyone relaxed.
meanings.sent5: The dankest joint he ever smoked left him in a state of pure bliss.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of dank, meaning very unpleasant or disagreeable.
meanings.sent1: The smell coming from the dumpster was the dankest odor she had ever encountered.
meanings.sent2: The dankest alley in the city was avoided by most pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: Despite the chef's efforts, the dish turned out to be the dankest meal anyone had tasted.
meanings.sent4: The dankest taste of spoiled milk lingered in her mouth long after she spit it out.
meanings.sent5: The dankest room in the house was the one with the leaky roof and moldy walls.
